sen.j: 紅しょうが（べにしょうが）は、ショウガの塊根を梅酢に漬けた漬物の一種。
sen.e: Beni-shoga is a pickles made from pickling groundnuts of ginger in vinegar from Japanese apricots.
Beni-shoga is a pickles made from pickling groundnuts of ginger in plum vinegar.
sen.cmt: vinegar from Japanese apricots を plum vinegar に修正しました。
sen.e: Beni-shoga is a pickles made from pickling groundnuts of ginger in plum vinegar.
The origin
Origin
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: Origin
How to make beni-shoga
How to make beni-shoga
How to make beni-shoga

sen.j: 球根生姜（ねしょうが）を塩で下漬けした後、梅酢（梅干しを漬けた後に残る漬け汁）で数日間漬けこみ、取り出して細切りにする。
sen.e: After pre-pickling blocks of ginger roots in salt, boil well in umezu (the vinegar that remains after pickling Japanese apricots) for a couple of days and take them out to be cut into thin strips.
sen.cmt: 「球根生姜」→ウェブ上では「塊状の根生姜」となっています。英訳ではそちらに沿って訳しました。
sen.e: After pre-pickling blocks of ginger roots in salt, boil well in plum vinegar for a couple of days and take them out to be cut into thin strips.
sen.cmt: umezu (the vinegar that remains after pickling Japanese apricots) を plum vinegar に修正しました。
sen.e: After pre-pickling blocks of ginger roots in salt, boil well in plum vinegar for a couple of days and take them out to be cut into thin strips.

sen.j: この際の梅酢は、シソを用いた梅酢を用いると（紫蘇の色が移って）濃い紫色になるが、シソを用いていない梅酢を用いた場合でも、ショウガの中にアントシアン系色素が含まれているため、梅酢の酸と反応して淡い薄紅色に漬けあがる。
sen.e: Although the umezu turns deep purple when it is made from the beefsteak plant (thanks to color transfer), even where umezu made without beefsteak plant is used pickled ginger turns faint red when it reacts with the acid of the umezu - because ginger contains pigment from the anthocyanin family.

Plum vinegar with beefsteak plant turns deep purple (thanks to color transfer), but even with the plum vinegar without beefsteak plant, ginger turns faint red as it reacts with the acid of plum vinegar due to the pigment from the anthocyanin family contained in it.

Plum vinegar with beefsteak plant turns deep purple (thanks to color transfer), but even with the plum vinegar without beefsteak plant, ginger turns faint red as it reacts with the acid of plum vinegar due to the pigment from the anthocyanin family contained in it.

sen.j: なお工業的に製造する場合は、赤系の着色料を混ぜた、梅酢を用いた調味液で、あらかじめ細切りにしておいたショウガを漬け込む製法が多い。
sen.e: When beni-shoga is pickled for industrial purposes, however, ginger cut into thin strips in advance are pickled mainly in a condiment liquid using umezu with red food coloring.
When beni-shoga is produced industrially, however, ginger shredded in advance are often pickled in a condiment liquid of plum vinegar with red food coloring.
When beni-shoga is produced industrially, however, ginger shredded in advance are often pickled in a condiment liquid of plum vinegar with red food coloring.

sen.j: そのまま食べることもあるが、基本的には色取り・あしらい・口直し・付け合わせとしての性格が強い。
sen.e: It can be eaten as it is, but its basic use is to supply color, to help arrange food pleasingly on the plate, as a palate refresher, and as relish.
It can be eaten as it is, but its basic use is to supply color, to help arrange food pleasingly on the plate, as a palate refresher, and as relish.
It can be eaten as it is, but its basic use is to supply color, to help arrange food pleasingly on the plate, as a palate refresher, and as relish.

sen.j: 牛丼や博多ラーメンの店のほとんどは、紅しょうがを入れた器を客席に置いており、客が自分でトッピングするようになっている。
sen.e: Most of the restaurants of Gyudon and Hakata ramen put containers of beni-shoga on customers' tables so that customers can help themselves.
Most of the restaurants of gyudon (rice covered with beef and vegetables) and Hakata ramen put containers of beni-shoga on customers' tables so that customers can help themselves.
sen.cmt: Gyudon を gyudon (rice covered with beef and vegetables) に修正しました。
sen.e: Most of the restaurants of gyudon (rice covered with beef and vegetables) and Hakata ramen put containers of beni-shoga on customers' tables so that customers can help themselves.

sen.j: 紅しょうがを付け合せにする料理

Hakata ramen (Chinese noodle which was made originally in Fukuoka City, Fukuoka Prefecture, using a pork bone broth and thin noodles)

sen.j: 寿司（ちらし寿司や巻き寿司）
sen.e: Sushi (Chirashi-zushi [a style of sushi where the topping is placed on a bed of rice, in a bowl] and Maki-zushi [sushi roll])

sen.j: -近畿地方では細く短冊に切ったものを掻き揚げした形態ではなく、塊を薄くスライスしたものを揚げた形態である。
sen.e: -In Kinki region, rather than cutting the different ingredients into strips, these ingredients are sliced thinly and then mixed together in tempura batter before being deep-fried.
-In Kinki region, rather than cutting the different ingredients into strips, these ingredients are sliced thinly and then mixed together in tempura batter before being deep-fried.
